posts.post_content:
One of two Tolstoi T206 Murr'y error cards.

The Murr'y error is the only Murr'y card with a small print dot next to the NY. This card has that, which means that it is a legit Murr'y error. The problem: there is paper loss exactly over the part of the name where the broken A should be. SGC agrees that this is a Murr'y error, but they won't slab it as such because of the paper loss. There is enough paper there to see that there is no A where there should be one, but the paper loss made SGC skittish. I have included a close up scan of the paper loss and the print dot.

Murr'y:[STRIKE] $400[/STRIKE] $325 net to me, shipped. (SOLD)
Bump for price drops & to remove sold cards
